Taxon name.Name: Aspergillus niger
Taxon name.Synonymy:
Current name: Aspergillus niger Tieghem 1867 MB#284309 
Taxonomic synonyms: 
   - Aspergillus foetidus Thom & Raper 1945 MB#284300 
   - Aspergillus aureus var. brevior Nakazawa, Simo & A. Watanabe 1936 MB#493810 
   - Aspergillus awamori var. fumeus Nakazawa, Simo & A. Watanabe 1936 MB#250920 
   - Aspergillus fuliginosus Peck 1873 MB#208679 
   - Aspergillus luchuensis Inui 1901 MB#151291 
   - Aspergillus cinnamomeus E. Schiemann 1912 MB#122195 
         - Aspergillus niger var. cinnamomeus (E. Schiemann) Thom & Raper 1945 MB#505077 
   - Aspergillus fuscus E. Schiemann 1912 MB#450741 
         - Aspergillus schiemanniae Thom 1916 MB#102113 
   - Aspergillus pyri W.H. English ? MB#453796 
   - Aspergillus niger var. altipes E. Schiemann 1912 MB#493817 
   - Sterigmatocystis nigra (Tieghem) Tieghem 1877 MB#231646 
   - Aspergillus lacticoffeatus Frisvad & Samson 2004 MB#500008 
   - Aspergillopsis nigra (Tieghem) Spegazzini 1911 MB#210007 
   - Rhopalocystis nigra (Tieghem) Grove 1911 MB#432029 
   - Aspergillus schiemanni Thom 1916 MB#252250

Nagoya protocol restrictions and complia: no known restrictions under the Nagoya protocol
History: IHEM, 1987 < CBS, 1965 < K.B. Raper < NRRL < C. Thom < A. Hollander, 1913
Applications: tannin-gallic acid fermentation (Raper, K.B.; Fennell, D.I. The Genus Aspergillus. Baltimore: Williams & Wilkins; 1965: p. 310); production of: pseudonigeran (1-3)-alpha-D-glucan (Carbohydr. Res. 23: 183-188, 1972), kynureninase-type enzymes (J. Bacteriol. 122: 235-244, 1975) and ß-glucosidases (Acta Biotechnol. 9: 179-190, 1989); structure of galactomannan (J. Biol. Chem. 252: 2584-2591, 1977); transformation of: sesquiterpene lactone costunolide (J. Chem. Soc. Perkin Trans. 1979: 3022-3028, 1979), acetanilid to aniline (Am. J. Pharm. Educ. 47: 127-129, 1983), pergolide to pergolide sulfoxide and pergolide sulfone (J. Pharm. Sci. 72: 733-736, 1983); treatment of pulp-mill wastes (U.S. Pat. 3,737,374)
